column5: Hopefully a link to Face Book works.  Some shore line in western Toronto was posted with no fishing signs this month.  TUFA (Toronto Urban Fishing Ambassadors) was successful in having the signs quickly removed.  TUFA was formed when city council banned shore fishing in Toronto harbour back in 2012.  We have shore fishing opportunities in Toronto in a large part due to the efforts of the TUFA group; especially one of the founders in particular David Clark.   https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=610558839086419&set=gm.1051864634837746&type=1

Well, that's some darn nice work by the group John.  Thank you for that info.  Shore angling spots are tougher and tougher to come by, and urban fishing locations seem to be going the way of the dodo.  Nasty to just post no fishing signs with absolutely no authority!  So good work by TUFA.

I just hope the people who do participate in urban shore fishing in the city continue to respect the areas they fish and clean up after themselves. It's the same reason you see "No Dogs" signs in a lot of public parks because people couldn't be bothered to not leave piles of dog dirt everywhere.
Yes, unfortunately a lot of fishermen are pigs.  TUFA also organizes shore cleanups.  Hopefull that will help.
Great to see this, David has made some great connections and has done a lot for Toronto fishermen!
I almost took that sign home with me but it was better I gave TUFA the heads up.
